Using these values of R t, we can then calculate the minimum (‘critical’) level of population immunity, P crit, acquired via vaccination or naturally-induced (i.e. after recovery from COVID-19), to halt the spread of infection in that population, using the formula: P crit= 1-(1/R t). So, for example, if the value of R t = 3 then P crit= 0.67, i.e. at least two-thirds of the population need to be immune.
